fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let m\colon R\rightarrowtail A \times B be a relation in a topos. The name of m is the exponential transpose \nu _{m}\colon B \to \Omega ^{A} of the classifier \chi _{m}\colon A \times B \to \Omega of m.
Let A be any object in a topos and let \{\}\colon A \to \Omega ^{A} be the name of the diagonal relation \Delta \colon A \rightarrowtail A \times A. \{\} is a monomorphism.
An (elementary) topos is a finitely complete and cartesian closed category equipped with a subobject classifier.
